paper.title: Risk contagion of COVID-19 to oil prices: A Markov switching GARCH and PCA approach
paper.abstract: The COVID-19 pandemic and its impact on crude oil prices created additional risks throughout the financial industry. To contribute to the ongoing debates, this paper empirically examined the risk contagion of COVID-19 to oil prices by incorporating a Markov-Switching GARCH (MS-GARCH) framework and the multivariate GARCH time series model, BEKK-GARCH model. The study examines data collected between 27 January 2020 and 31 December 2020. Further, we used principal component analysis (PCA) to find principal factors explaining the overall variability of the global economic indicators that contribute to the risk. Finally, to support the risk transmission effects between COVID-19 and oil prices, we conducted regression analysis, while controlling for the factors extracted from the PCA method.

domain_result.justification: The paper focuses on examining the risk contagion of COVID-19 to oil prices using advanced econometric models like MS-GARCH and BEKK-GARCH, along with PCA to identify risk factors. This study is primarily concerned with understanding and managing financial risks associated with market volatility, which falls under the domain of Financial Risk Management.
